Name: NAACC Survey ID
Description: NAACC Survey Identification
Citation: North Atlantic Aquatic Connectivity Collaborative, 2021, NAACC Data Center: website accessed August 3, 2021 at https://naacc.org/naacc_data_center_home.cfm.

Name: NAACC Code
Description: NAACC Crossing Code (xy and decimal latitude and longitude)

Name: NAACC Type
Description: NAACC Stream Crossing Type (ex. Culvert)

Name: Road
Description: NAACC Road name

Name: Stream Name
Description: NAACC Stream name from USGS topographic maps

Name: Drainage Area
Description: Area that drains to a point on a stream
Citation: Drainage area determine from digital elevation models derived from lidar data (Massachusetts Bureau of Geographic Information, 2022, MassGIS data: lidar terrain data, website accessed April 22, 2022 at https://www.mass.gov/info-details/massgis-data-lidar-terrain-data#:~:text=Project%20Areas%20%20%20%20Year%20%2F%20Project,%20184%20GB%20%205%20more%20rows%20).

Name: Mean Basin Elevation
Description: Mean basin elevation
Citation: Zarriello, P.J., 2017, Magnitude of flood flows at selected annual exceedance probabilities for streams in Massachusetts: U.S. Geological Survey Scientific Investigations Report 2016–5156, 54 p., https://doi.org/10.3133/sir20165156.

Name: Percent Storage from NLCD2006
Description: Percentage of water bodies and wetlands determined from the NLCD 2006
Citation: Zarriello, P.J., 2017, Magnitude of flood flows at selected annual exceedance probabilities for streams in Massachusetts: U.S. Geological Survey Scientific Investigations Report 2016–5156, 54 p., https://doi.org/10.3133/sir20165156.

Name: Mean Basin Slope from 10m DEM
Description: Mean basin slope computed from 10 m DEM
Citation: Bent, G.C., and Waite, A.M., 2013, Equations for estimating bankfull channel geometry and discharge for streams in Massachusetts: U.S. Geological Survey Scientific Investigations Report 2013–5155, 62 p., http://dx.doi.org/10.3133/sir20135155.

Name: 10-year Peakflow
Description: Maximum instantaneous flow that occurs with a 10% annual exceedance probability
Citation: Zarriello, P.J., 2017, Magnitude of flood flows at selected annual exceedance probabilities for streams in Massachusetts: U.S. Geological Survey Scientific Investigations Report 2016–5156, 54 p., https://doi.org/10.3133/sir20165156.

Name: 25-year Peakflow
Description: Maximum instantaneous flow that occurs with a 4% annual exceedance probability

Name: 50-year Peakflow
Description: Maximum instantaneous flow that occurs with a 2% annual exceedance probability

Name: 100-year Peakflow
Description: Maximum instantaneous flow that occurs with a 1% annual exceedance probability

Name: Bankfull Width
Description: Bankfull width
Citation: Bent, G.C., and Waite, A.M., 2013, Equations for estimating bankfull channel geometry and discharge for streams in Massachusetts: U.S. Geological Survey Scientific Investigations Report 2013–5155, 62 p., http://dx.doi.org/10.3133/sir20135155.

Name: Bankfull Mean Depth
Description: Bankfull depth

Name: Bankfull XS Area
Description: Bankfull area

Name: Coldwater Fisheries Resources
Description: Stream is a coldwater fisheries. 0=no, 1=yes
Citation: Massachusetts Division of Fisheries, 2022, Coldwater fish resources, website accessed April 30, 2022 at https://www.mass.gov/info-details/coldwater-fish-resources.

Name: Areas of Critical Environmental Concerns
Description: Stream is an Area of Critical Environmental Concerns . Boolean value 0=no, 1=yes
Citation: Massachusetts Department of Conversation and Recreation, Ecology and ACEC Program, 2022, ACEC program overview: website, accessed April 30, 2022 at https://www.mass.gov/service-details/acec-program-overview.

Name: BioMap 2 Aquatic Core
Description: Stream is a BioMap 2 Aquatic Core. Boolean value 0=no, 1=yes
Citation: Massachusetts Department of Fish and Game, Natural Heritage Endangered Species Program, 2022, BioMap2 web site, accessed April 29, 2022 at http://maps.massgis.state.ma.us/dfg/biomap2.htm

Name: Wild and Scenic Rivers
Description: Stream is a Wild and Scenic Rivers. Boolean value 0=no, 1=yes
Citation: National Wild and Scenic Rivers System, 2022, Massachusetts: website, accessed April 30, 2022 at https://www.rivers.gov/massachusetts.php.

Name: Critical Linkages
Description: Statewide Critical Linkages Percentile (other = >25%, medium restoration potential = top 20-25%, high restoration potential = top 10-20%, higher restoration potential = top 5-10%, and highest restoration potential = top <5%): Derived from UMass DSL data
Citation: University of Massachusetts at Amherst, Conservation Assessment and Prioritization System, 2022, The critical linkage project: website, accessed April 30, 2022 at http://www.umasscaps.org/applications/critical-linkages.html.

Name: Cold Water Critical Linkages
Description: Coldwater Critical Linkages Percentile (0 = < top 30%, 1 = top 30%, 2 = top 20%, and 3 = top 10%): Derived from UMass DSL data
Citation: University of Massachusetts at Amherst, Conservation Assessment and Prioritization System, 2022, The critical linkage project: website, accessed April 30, 2022 at http://www.umasscaps.org/applications/critical-linkages.html.

Name: Habitat Quality Score
Description: Habitat quality score. Sum of “yes’s (1’s) for coldwater fisheries, Area of Critical Environmental Concern, Biomap2 aquatic core, and Wild and Scenic River (values can be from 0 – 6; 0 = General quality, 1 = higher quality, >=2 = highest quality)
Citation: Scott Jackson, University of Massachusetts at Amherst, written commun., 2022

Name: Restoration Connectivity Potential Score
Description: Connectivity Restoration Potential Score. Derived from Statewide Critical Linkages and Coldwater Critical Linkages values. Sum of CRPCLINK or CEPCWCLINK values. Scoring - see USGS SIR - fig. 5.
Citation: Scott Jackson, University of Massachusetts at Amherst, written commun., 2022

Name: Maximum Extent Practicable (MEP) Cost Factor
Description: Maximum Extent Practicable (MEP) Cost Factor. (HQSCORE and CRPSCORE)
Citation: Scott Jackson, University of Massachusetts at Amherst, written commun., 2022

Name: Hydraulic Design Flood
Description: Hydraulic Design Flood Recurrence Interval, 10=10-yr, 25=25-yr, 50=50-yr, 100=100-yr
Citation: Massachusetts Department of Transportation, 2020, Load and resistance factor design (LRFD) Bridge Manual – Part I, Chapter 1 bridge site exploration, January 2020 revision, 26 p, accessed October 1, 2021 at https://www.mass.gov/doc/chapter-1-bridge-site-exploration/download.

Name: Roadway Classification
Description: Roadway classification code values 0-7 classification codes TBD
Citation: Massachusetts Department of Transportation, 2021, Roadway culverts, accessed October 20, 2021 at https://geo-massdot.opendata.arcgis.com/datasets/MassDOT::culverts-1/about.

Name: Box Culvert Span
Description: Span (s) of box culvert design

Name: Box Culvert Height
Description: Height (h) of box culvert design

Name: Box Culvert Length
Description: Length (l) of box culvert design

Name: Box Culvert Area
Description: Area of box culvert design

Name: Box Culvert Material
Description: Box culvert material

Name: Box Culvert Upstream Channel Invert Elevation
Description: Elevation (NAVD88) of channel invert at upstream face of box culvert

Name: Box Culvert Downstream Channel Invert Elevation
Description: Elevation (NAVD88) of channel invert at downstream face of box culvert

Name: Box Culvert Road Deck Elevation
Description: Elevation (NAVD88) of road deck over box culvert

Name: Box Culvert Maximum Flow to Pass Through
Description: Maximum flood flow recurrence interval to pass through box culvert without backwater

Name: Box SCS Culvert Type
Description: Culvert design (3-sided box culvert meets SCS)
Citation: Massachusetts Department of Fish and Game, Division of Ecological Restoration, 2012, Massachusetts stream crossing handbook, 2nd edition, accessed August 1, 2021 at https://www.mass.gov/doc/massachusetts-stream-crossing-handbook/download.

Name: Box SCS Embedment
Description: Not applicable for 3-sided box culvert designs

Name: Box SCS Substrate
Description: Material at culvert bottom (Natural meets SCS)

Name: Box Water Depth and Velocity Ratio
Description: Comparable water depth and velocity ratio: TBD - variety of flows or a low-flow such as the 90% flow duration

Name: Box SCS Span Ratio
Description: Ratio of box culvert span to bankfull width. (Meets SCS >= 1.2 )

Name: Box SCS Openness Ratio
Description: Ratio of box culvert cross-sectional area to length. (Meets SCS >= 0.82)

Description: Span (s) of arch culvert design
